alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 18 at 4:20PM EDT until July 18 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Warren County in southwestern Ohio... Western Clinton County in southwestern Ohio... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 419 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Morrow, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Clarksville, Harveysburg, Martinsville, Oregonia, Fort Ancient, Oakland, Cuba, State Route 350 at US Route 22, Ogden, Kingman, Burtonville and Cowan Lake State Park. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 33 and 47. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
